name: 1H-pyrazole-5-methanol, 3-methyl-
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-3901
Reason: 1H-pyrazole-5-methanol, 3-methyl- has a melting point that can be predicted by comparing it to the base unit of benzene, which has a melting point of 5.5°C. The methyl group in this compound increases the molecular weight and size, which generally raises the melting point by approximately +10°C. The pyrazole ring itself can also contribute to the melting point due to its rigidity and potential hydrogen bonding, estimated at around +20°C. The methyl group in the pyrazole ring can also participate in hydrogen bonding, which can further contribute to the melting point, estimated at around +10°C.
